articles.description:
Sep  3, 21:55 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Sep  2, 09:06 UTC
Update - Our upstream provider is still undergoing a DDoS attack. We're working with them to mitigate this issue. Our system is still experiencing sporadic connection issues.
If you have domains that expire in the next 48 hours, and you're unable to renew them, please contact our support for assistance. This incident doesn't affect domains that are set to auto-renew.
If you have initiated a transfer, we're monitoring your requests. These orders will complete but updates in our system might be delayed because of this incident.
Sep  1, 09:37 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Sep  1, 09:37 UTC
Monitoring - One of our upstream providers is undergoing a DDoS attack and registrar operations are partially degraded.
articles.title: Registrar operations partially degraded

articles.description:
Aug 28, 11:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Aug 28, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Aug 27, 08:49 UTC
Scheduled - Our upstream registrar provider will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.
During this scheduled system maintenance, the following services may be affected by a service interruption and/or timeout:
- domain registrations
- domain renewals
- domain transfers
- domain updates updates
DNS resolution will not be impacted, domains will continue to resolve as usual.
articles.title: Registrar Scheduled Maintenance

articles.description:
Aug 28, 01:04 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Aug 28, 00:28 UTC
Monitoring - Our legacy Vanity Name Servers IPs are accepting traffic back again. We are monitoring the implemented fix
Aug 27, 23:54 UTC
Identified - Our vanity name servers using legacy IP addresses are currently unavailable. Those IPs are: 
- 198.241.10.53
- 198.241.11.53
- 50.31.242.53
- 50.31.243.53
We are currently working on deploying a solution for it.
Please notice that current vanity name servers using the current set of IP addresses are working as expected. https://support.dnsimple.com/articles/vanity-nameservers/
articles.title: Vanity Name Servers using legacy IPs outage

articles.description:
Aug 26, 08:43 UTC
Resolved - Connection to our registrar partner has been restored. Domain registration, transfer, and Sectigo SSL certificate issuance is operational.
Aug 26, 08:24 UTC
Identified - We're experiencing connection issues with one of our registrar partners. Domain registration, domain transfers, and Sectigo SSL certificates are impacted.
DNS resolution is not impacted. Existing domains in our system are responding correctly.
articles.title: Connection issues with registrar partner

articles.author: Anton Kirichok
articles.description:
Dear Customers, This is to let you know that the registry of .SG and .COM.SG domains will be processing scheduled maintenance. The time frame for the maintenance is as follows: September 4, 12:00 PM – 08:00 PM EST | September 4, 16:00 – September 5, 00:00 UTC Domain availability checks, registrations, renewals, updates, and WHOIS … Continue reading [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021 →
The post [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021 appeared first on Namecheap Status.
articles.title: [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021

articles.description:
Aug 19, 02:00 BST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Aug 18, 23:00 BST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Aug 17, 14:49 BST
Scheduled - During this maintenance period we will be making configuration changes to several core routers. We do not expect these changes to be service affecting however it should be considered an at-risk period.
articles.title: Emergency Network Maintenance

articles.description:
Aug 17, 16:00 BST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Aug 17, 09:02 BST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Aug  9, 14:40 BST
Scheduled - During this maintenance window we will be performing a generator load test. This will involve transitioning from mains power to generators and then back again.
We do not expect this to be service affecting however this should be considered an at-risk period.
articles.title: Generator Load Test

articles.description:

Scheduled - During this maintenance period we will be making configuration changes to several core routers and access routers. We do not expect these changes to be service affecting however it should be considered an at-risk period.
articles.title: Emergency Network Maintenance

articles.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 11, 17:00 UTC  -  Sep 19, 22:00 UTC
Sep  2, 19:31 UTC
Scheduled - Throughout the month of September 2021, we will be performing maintenance on various datacenters. Each window will be between 1am-6am local time of the data center. There is a possibility of a slight increase in latency during these maintenance windows. The most up-to-date schedule can be located here: Planned maintenance for Cloudflare data centers.
articles.title: Upcoming Datacenter Upgrades

articles.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 7, 23:00 UTC  -  Sep 8, 00:00 UTC
Aug 23, 22:29 UTC
Scheduled - The Cloudflare Dashboard will be unavailable during this maintenance window in order to improve future resiliency of the system. All dashboard UI actions will be unavailable during the window.  Cloudflare's API and edge will be unaffected during this maintenance.
articles.title: Dashboard Maintenance

articles.description:
Sep  4, 22:04 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Sep  4, 17:55 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Sep  4, 17:46 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Image Resizing the AVIF image format in some later versions of the Chrome browser, including but not limited to Version 93.0.4577.63. We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.
articles.title: Image Resizing Availability Issues

Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Sep  3, 20:09 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Tunnel. Some users are reporting errors when attempting to add new IP/CIDR ranges to their Tunnel. This does not impact Tunnels with existing routes. 
We are working to understand and mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.
articles.title: Argo Tunnel Creation Issues

articles.description:
Sep  3, 08:16 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Sep  3, 05:53 UTC

We will update the status once we implement the fix.

Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard for WAF.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
Some Customers Enabling WAF are impacted as they may not be able to enable it
articles.title: Cloudflare Dashboard issues

We will update the status once the issue is resolved.

Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related APIs.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

The impact has been mitigated.

Aug 24, 03:47 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Aug 24, 03:24 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard.
IP Access Rules page has a long button in Firefox which is preventing Firefox users to add new rules.
Recommendation: Please use another browser like Safari, Chrome.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
Customers using the Dashboard are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.
articles.title: Cloudflare Dashboard issues

articles.description:
Aug 21, 01:28 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
Aug 21, 01:04 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard firewall IP access rule UI. Customer may experience pagination of IP access rule not fully display on the UI
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
Customers using the IP access rule Dashboard are impacted, but customers can still use API to create IP access rules.
articles.title: Cloudflare Dashboard IP access rule UI issue

Aug 10, 00:53 UTC
Scheduled - On August 24, 2021 GlobalSign will rotate their Atlas TLS CAs intermediate certificates.
Beginning 2022, GlobalSign will start rotating their intermediate certificates on a quarterly basis, on the second Monday of every quarter. 
For customers who are using Fastly TLS managed certificates issued by GlobalSign, also known as Fastly TLS Commercial CA, this change will require action on your part if you are using certificate or public key pinning to avoid any impact to your traffic. 
For more information on the update from GlobalSign, please refer to the following links:
https://www.globalsign.com/en/blog/upcoming-changes-publicly-trusted-tls-certificates 
https://support.globalsign.com/atlas/atlas-tls/atlas-tls-ica-rotations-2021
articles.title: Globalsign Intermediate Certificate Rotation

Aug 13, 00:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Aug 12, 00:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Aug  3, 06:10 UTC
Scheduled - Fastly’s global network is growing, and with that growth comes changes and enhancements in some of our naming conventions and best practices. Refer to our server.identity and server.hostname pages on Developer Hub for an in depth explanation of the new cache naming schema. Starting no earlier than Thursday, 12 Aug 2021, we will begin populating the node name in some situations according to a new scheme.
We’d like to share these changes so that if our customers are performing any troubleshooting or logging these values, one can not only know with certainty exactly what node processed a request, but also update any log parsing or automation to properly parse these values.
Please note that for most of our existing infrastructure, the naming scheme is not changing, and you will continue to see these values set to the previous scheme for some of your traffic and log data. We suggest that if customers are parsing these fields out and breaking them down into individual values (such as the node name and POP) to adjust any tooling or automation to be able to handle both formats.
Feel free to reach out to our support team if you have any questions on these changes.
server.identity
server.hostname
articles.title: New Cache Naming Schema
